title: PAWNSHOP / TABLE OF KNICKKNACKS
description: You look at and ask Roy about the figurines on the accessory stand.

dialogueTree.title: Knick-knacks Stand: "You see rows of toy soldiers guardi..."
dialogueTree.text: You see rows of toy soldiers guarding the rest of the trinkets displayed on the table: some on horseback, others in rags, others yet in bright blue uniforms. All are stern and unyielding in their duty.

links.title: You: "Win 'her' back?"
links.text: Win 'her' back?

links.title: Inland Empire: "Yes! Buy something nice! A figurine..."
links.text: Yes! Buy something nice! A figurine.

links.title: Volition: "This sounds... off. You shouldn't t..."
links.text: This sounds... off. You shouldn't trust this guy.

links.title: You: "Inspect the knights on horseback."
links.text: Inspect the knights on horseback.

links.title: Knick-knacks Stand: "Big men on big horses clad in lamel..."
links.text: Big men on big horses clad in lamellar armour and carrying flintlocks. The kind that would mow down a line of enemy soldiers in the blink of an eye.

links.title: You: "(Point at the knights on horseback...."
links.text: (Point at the knights on horseback.) "These are Franconigerian cavalry, right?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Mhm. I used to be very serious abo..."
links.text: "Mhm. I used to be very serious about my Franconigerian knights..." He looks at the dusty figurines in the dim light.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "...a long, long time ago."
links.text: ...a long, long time ago.

links.title: You: "(Point at the knights on horseback...."
links.text: (Point at the knights on horseback.) "Who are they?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Franconigerian knights." He looks..."
links.text: "Franconigerian knights." He looks at the dusty figurines in the dim light. "I used to be very serious about these guys."

links.title: You: ""These are Franconigerian cavalry,..."
links.text: "These are Franconigerian cavalry, right?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Yes!" The man behind the glass tak..."
links.text: "Yes!" The man behind the glass takes says. "A little worn around the edges, but I'm pretty sure it's fully intact."

links.title: You: ""Shopkeep, what are these?""
links.text: "Shopkeep, what are these?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""A classic set. The figurines repre..."
links.text: "A classic set. The figurines represent the Fifth-century Franconigerian Cavalry."

links.title: You: "Inspect the blue uniforms."
links.text: Inspect the blue uniforms.

links.title: Knick-knacks Stand: "They're not all blue. These figurin..."
links.text: They're not all blue. These figurines also wear gold coats and caps, complimented by orange trousers. They are variously posed, wielding swords and rifles with bayonets.

links.title: You: ""Wait, this looks like René, the ol..."
links.text: "Wait, this looks like René, the old guy who was playing petanque."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""This is what the loyalists looked..."
links.text: "This is what the loyalists looked like, yes." He inspects the figurine. "At first. Then they wised up and got camouflage."

links.title: Knick-knacks Stand: "That they do -- the uniforms are pr..."
links.text: That they do -- the uniforms are precisely the same. Some even have the same shape medals pinned to their chests.

links.title: You: "(Point at the blue figurines.) "Wha..."
links.text: (Point at the blue figurines.) "What exactly are these?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Which ones?" The man peers from hi..."
links.text: "Which ones?" The man peers from his glass box. "Ah! Royalist soldiers from the time of the Revolution. The uniforms are painted a bit too brightly, I suppose."

links.title: You: "(Point at the blue figurines.) "Are..."
links.text: (Point at the blue figurines.) "Are these royalist soldiers?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Which ones?" The man peers from hi..."
links.text: "Which ones?" The man peers from his glass box. "Ah, those! Yes, they are. I find the paint job a bit gaudy, but children like bright colours indiscriminately."

links.title: You: "Inspect the figurines in rags."
links.text: Inspect the figurines in rags.

links.title: Knick-knacks Stand: "This set of soldiers isn't meant to..."
links.text: This set of soldiers isn't meant to look impressive. A few have rifles, but most of them carry pistols -- some even shovels and tall sticks.

links.title: You: "(Point at the figurines in rags.) "..."
links.text: (Point at the figurines in rags.) "Are these even soldiers?"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""You're probably talking about the..."
links.text: "You're probably talking about the revolutionaries, yes?" the man behind the glass answers. "Yes -- they are soldiers. Revolutionary soldiers."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""I think their poverty has been exa..."
links.text: "I think their poverty has been exaggerated for effect. When you place them next to the royalists, it doesn't seem like they could possibly win."

links.title: You: ""It's meant to give people hope --..."
links.text: "It's meant to give people hope -- even *we* can do it."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Maybe.""
links.text: "Maybe."

links.title: Inland Empire: "He seems to have his own take on th..."
links.text: He seems to have his own take on the conflict played out in perpetuity by these toys. Might be interesting to find out what it is...

links.title: You: ""The contrast is meant to be dishea..."
links.text: "The contrast is meant to be disheartening. As it ought to be."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""I don't like either set very much,..."
links.text: "I don't like either set very much, to be honest, but there are many parents among my customers."

links.title: You: ""It is impossible to win against th..."
links.text: "It is impossible to win against the cohorts of capital. Ask my friend Garte, whose bitch it made me."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Okay." He doesn't bat an eye. "I d..."
links.text: "Okay." He doesn't bat an eye. "I don't like either set too much, to be honest."

links.title: You: ""I wish it was more *nuanced*. As i..."
links.text: "I wish it was more *nuanced*. As it stands, I cannot comment."

links.title: You: "Dig up a truly *cool* figurine in t..."
links.text: Dig up a truly *cool* figurine in the box under the table.

links.title: Interfacing: "Why, what's this? A headless man ri..."
links.text: Why, what's this? A headless man riding a horse? A headless man wearing futuristic track suit trousers that say FALN!

links.title: You: ""The Headless FALN Rider!""
links.text: "The Headless FALN Rider!"

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Indeed." He immediately knows what..."
links.text: "Indeed." He immediately knows what you're talking about. "I think I even have his cap somewhere down here..." He looks for it. "A tiny miniature FALN cap to go with it. Yours for 50 cents."

links.title: Rhetoric: "He doesn't elaborate on what that m..."
links.text: He doesn't elaborate on what that means -- it's unlikely that he will.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant studies the figurine..."
links.text: The lieutenant studies the figurine with amusement.

links.title: Interfacing: "Cool rider, right? I knew we'd find..."
links.text: Cool rider, right? I knew we'd find something worthwhile here! Buy it!

links.title: You: ""What is this?" (Show it to the sho..."
links.text: "What is this?" (Show it to the shopkeep.)

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Oh, that's the Headless FALN Rider.""
links.text: "Oh, that's the Headless FALN Rider."

links.title: You: ""*Who*?""
Bird's Nest Roy: ""The Headless FALN Rider. It's an u..."
links.text: "The Headless FALN Rider. It's an urban legend -- about a man who rides the streets of Revachol sporting a FALN tracksuit. As you can see, he's missing his head." He points at the decapitated figurine.

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Fifty cents. Bargain-priced! I'll..."
links.text: "Fifty cents. Bargain-priced! I'll throw in the tiny cap too -- I think he's looking for it, or something. That part of the story has many interpretations."

links.title: Logic: "He lost his cap when he lost his he..."
links.text: He lost his cap when he lost his head. Perhaps he's looking for the *head*?

links.title: You: ""Of course." (Nod knowingly.)"
links.text: "Of course." (Nod knowingly.)

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""There's been a lot of *interest* i..."
links.text: "There's been a lot of *interest* in that particular figurine. I had to hide it so it wouldn't fall into the wrong hands."

links.title: Rhetoric: "He doesn't elaborate on these 'wron..."
links.text: He doesn't elaborate on these 'wrong hands' -- it's unlikely that he ever will.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant studies the tiny fig..."
links.text: The lieutenant studies the tiny figurine in your hand. "I've heard about it," he says with amusement, "I've heard the Headless FALN Rider rides a headless bull."

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Yes, there are several competing v..."
links.text: "Yes, there are several competing versions of the story, but I believe this figurine is a more canonical representation."

links.title: You: "(Look at Kim, then back at Roy.) "S..."
links.text: (Look at Kim, then back at Roy.) "Sorry, what are we talking about again?"

links.title: You: ""What do you mean?""
links.text: "What do you mean?"

links.title: Interfacing: "Everything you pick out seems faded..."
links.text: Everything you pick out seems faded, chipped, and sad somehow. Most of them are  just broken toys.

links.title: You: "Purchase the Headless FALN Rider an..."
links.text: Purchase the Headless FALN Rider and his cap.

links.title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Did I mention that this figurine i..."
links.text: "Did I mention that this figurine is supposed to be lucky? Always carry it with you." He grins.

links.title: Suggestion: "That was a very smooth salesman's g..."
links.text: That was a very smooth salesman's grin that almost comes off as earnest. You should learn from him.

links.title: You: "Step away from the table. [Leave.]"
links.text: Step away from the table. [Leave.]

links.title: Inland Empire: "Try to find something pretty and co..."
links.text: Try to find something pretty and cool here. Then use it to win her back!
